symbols.name: sap.ui.commons
symbols.description: Common basic controls, mainly intended for desktop scenarios

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.Accordion
nodes.description: Contains N sections, acting as containers for any library control

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.AccordionSection
nodes.description: Represents a panel which is a container for other controls.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.ApplicationHeader
nodes.description: The application header control stands on the top of any application page.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.Area
nodes.description: Used for defining areas in an image map.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.AutoComplete
nodes.description: Textfield with list based text completion.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.BorderLayoutAreaData
nodes.description: The object contains the available parameters for BorderLayout's Area.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.Button
nodes.description: Enables users to trigger actions such as save or print.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.ButtonStyle
nodes.description: different styles for a button.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.Callout
nodes.description: Callout is a small popup with some useful information and links that is shown when a mouse is hovered over a specific view element.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.CalloutBase
nodes.description: CalloutBase is a building block for Callout.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.Carousel
nodes.description: Carousel holds multiple controls and displays them vertically or horizontally next to each other.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.CheckBox
nodes.description: Provides a box which can be flagged, the box has a label.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.ColorPicker
nodes.description: This control gives the user the opportunity to choose a color.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.ColorPickerMode
nodes.description: Different styles for a ColorPicker.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.ComboBox
nodes.description: The control provides a field that allows end users to either enter some text, or to choose an entry out of a list of pre-defined items.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.DatePicker
nodes.description: Allows end users to interact with dates.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.Dialog
nodes.description: An interactive window appearing on request displaying information to the user.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.DropdownBox
nodes.description: The control provides a field that allows end users to an entry out of a list of pre-defined items.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.FileUploader
nodes.description: The framework generates an input field and a button with text "Browse ...".

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.FileUploaderParameter
nodes.description: Represents a parameter for the FileUploader which is rendered as a hidden inputfield.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.FocusInfo
nodes.description: The object representing the serialized focus information.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.FormattedTextView
nodes.description: The FormattedTextView control allows the usage of a limited set of HTML tags for display.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.FormattedTextViewControl
nodes.description: Marker interface for common controls which are suitable for use within a FormattedTextView.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.HorizontalDivider
nodes.description: Divides the screen in visual areas.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.HorizontalDividerHeight
nodes.description: Enumeration of possible HorizontalDivider height settings.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.HorizontalDividerType
nodes.description: Enumeration of possible HorizontalDivider types.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.Image
nodes.description: A wrapper around the IMG tag.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.ImageMap
nodes.description: Combination of image areas where at runtime these areas are starting points for hyperlinks or actions

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.InPlaceEdit
nodes.description: The InPlaceEdit is a functionality to have text in display mode that can be changed in place.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.Label
nodes.description: The control is used for labeling other controls.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.LabelDesign
nodes.description: Available label display modes.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.Link
nodes.description: Provides an absolute or relative reference to an internal or external URL.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.ListBox
nodes.description: Provides a list of items from which users can choose an item.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.Menu
nodes.description: A menu is an interactive element which provides a choice of different actions to the user.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.MenuBar
nodes.description: Represents a user interface area which is the entry point for menus with their menu items.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.MenuBarDesign
nodes.description: Determines the visual design of a MenuBar.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.MenuButton
nodes.description: Common button control that opens a menu when clicked by the user.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.MenuItem
nodes.description: Standard item to be used inside a menu.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.MenuItemBase
nodes.description: Abstract base class for menu item which provides common properties and events for all concrete item implementations.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.MenuTextFieldItem
nodes.description: Special menu item which contains a label and a text field.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.Message
nodes.description: Creates the "Message"s to be supplied to the "MessageBar" Control.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.MessageBar
nodes.description: Creates an instance of a MessageBar Control, for displaying messages.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.MessageBox
nodes.description: Provides methods to create standard alerts, confirmation dialogs, or arbitrary message boxes.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.MessageList
nodes.description: Instantiated by the "MessageBar" Control if the user requests to generate the corresponding "MessageList".

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.MessageToast
nodes.description: Responsible for displaying the new incoming messages, one at the time, on top of the MessageBar.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.MessageType
nodes.description:
[Enter description for MessageType]

This enum is part of the 'sap/ui/commons/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'MessageType'.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.Paginator
nodes.description: Provides navigation between pages within a list of numbered pages.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.PaginatorEvent
nodes.description:
Distinct paginator event types

This enum is part of the 'sap/ui/commons/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'PaginatorEvent'.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.Panel
nodes.description: Represents a container with scroll functionality, that can be used for text and controls.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.PasswordField
nodes.description: A text field with masked characters which borrows its properties and methods from TextField.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.ProgressIndicator
nodes.description: Shows the progress of a process in a graphical way.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.RadioButton
nodes.description: RadioButton is a control similar to CheckBox, but it allows the user to choose only one of the predefined set of options.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.RadioButtonGroup
nodes.description: The RadioButtonGroup is a basic control that is used to provide area for making interactive choice out of a set of options.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.RangeSlider
nodes.description: The interactive control is displayed either as a horizontal or a vertical line with two pointers and units of measurement.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.RatingIndicator
nodes.description: RatingIndicator is used to let the user do some rating on a given topic.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.RatingIndicatorVisualMode
nodes.description: Possible values for the visualization of float values in the RatingIndicator Control.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.ResponsiveContainer
nodes.description: Is used to provide a container, which can show different content depending on its current width.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.ResponsiveContainerRange
nodes.description: Defines a range for the ResponsiveContainer

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.RichTooltip
nodes.description: Is used to provide tool tips that can have long text, image and title.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.RoadMap
nodes.description: RoadMap is used to display step-by-step work flows of a clearly defined work process.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.RoadMapStep
nodes.description: Step used within a RoadMap Control.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.RowRepeater
nodes.description: This control displays items in a stacked list format, allowing the user to page in order to see more items or to use the offered filtering and sorting capabilities in order to manipulate the displayed data.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.RowRepeaterDesign
nodes.description: Determines the visual design of a RowRepeater.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.RowRepeaterFilter
nodes.description: This element is used by the RowRepeater and allows to define a filter in this context along with the related data such as a text and an icon.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.RowRepeaterSorter
nodes.description: This element is used by the RowRepeater and allows to define a sorter in this context along with the related data such as a text and an icon.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.SearchField
nodes.description: Allows the user to type search queries and to trigger the search.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.SearchProvider
nodes.description: A SearchProvider which can be attached to a Search Field.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.SegmentedButton
nodes.description: The SegmentedButton provides a group of multiple buttons.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.Slider
nodes.description: The interactive control is displayed either as a horizontal or a vertical line with a pointer and units of measurement.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.Splitter
nodes.description: Allows to split the screen into two areas.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.SplitterSize
nodes.description: A string type that represents subset of CSS size values.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.Tab
nodes.description: Represents a single tab in a TabStrip control.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.TabStrip
nodes.description: TabStrip represents a container for tab controls, which contain the content and generally other controls.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.TextArea
nodes.description: Control to enter or display multible row text.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.TextField
nodes.description: Renders an input field for text input.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.TextView
nodes.description: Is used to display some continous text.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.TextViewColor
nodes.description: Semantic Colors of a text.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.TextViewDesign
nodes.description: Designs for TextView.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.Title
nodes.description: Represents a title element that can be used for aggregation with other controls

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.TitleLevel
nodes.description: Level of a title.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.ToggleButton
nodes.description: The ToggleButton Control is a Button that can be toggled between pressed and normal state

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.Toolbar
nodes.description: A horizontal row of items where in many cases the single toolbar items are buttons containing icons.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.ToolbarDesign
nodes.description: Determines the visual design of a Toolbar.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.ToolbarItem
nodes.description: Marker interface for common controls which are suitable for use within a toolbar.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.ToolbarSeparator
nodes.description: A small vertical line that is generally added to the tool bar between the items to visually separate them.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.ToolbarSeparatorDesign
nodes.description: Design of the Toolbar Separator.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.Tree
nodes.description: Simple tree to display item in a hierarchical way

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.TreeNode
nodes.description: Tree node element

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.TreeSelectionMode
nodes.description:
Selection mode of the tree

This enum is part of the 'sap/ui/commons/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'TreeSelectionMode'.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.TriStateCheckBox
nodes.description: TriStateCheckBox to reflect mixed state for checkboxes.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.TriStateCheckBoxState
nodes.description:
States for TriStateCheckBox

This enum is part of the 'sap/ui/commons/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'TriStateCheckBoxState'.

nodes.name: sap.ui.commons.ValueHelpField
nodes.description: A TextField with an attached icon which triggeres an event.

symbols.name: sap.ui.commons.Accordion
symbols.description: Contains N sections, acting as containers for any library control

properties.name: openedSectionsId
properties.description: Section IDs that are opened by default at application start

properties.description: When the specified width is less than the width of a section content, a horizontal scroll bar is provided.

aggregations.description: Empty container used to display any library control

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new Accordion.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

parameters.description: IDs of the sections to be closed. Can be initial in the case of no previously opened section.

events.name: sectionsReorder

parameters.name: movedSectionId
parameters.description: ID of the moved section

parameters.name: newIndex
parameters.description: New index of the moved section

events.description: Event is triggered when the user changes the position of a section.

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.description: The section to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

methods.name: attachSectionClose

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.commons.Accordion itself

methods.description:
Attaches event handler fnFunction to the sectionClose event of this sap.ui.commons.Accordion.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.commons.Accordion itself.

Event is triggered when the user closes a section.

Sets a new value for property width.

When the specified width is less than the width of a section content, a horizontal scroll bar is provided.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is '200px'.

symbols.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.38. replaced by sap.m.Panel.

symbols.name: sap.ui.commons.AccordionSection
symbols.description: Represents a panel which is a container for other controls. The container does not have any layout function.

properties.name: collapsed
properties.description: It is recommended to adjust the settings for the width when the section is set to 'collapsed'.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.34. Use Accordion's "openedSectionsId" property

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: It is required that the used theme supports the control.

properties.name: maxHeight
properties.description: When the section content exceeds maxHeight, a vertical scroll bar appears.

properties.name: title
properties.description: Text for the section header

aggregations.name: content
aggregations.description: Aggregates the controls that are contained in the panel. The control layout is browser-dependent. For a stable content layout, use a layout control as direct single child. When the panel dimensions are set, the child control may have width and height of 100%; when the panel dimensions are not set, the child defines the panel size.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new AccordionSection.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

parameters.name: left
parameters.description: Horizontal scroll position

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: Vertical scroll position

events.description: Event is fired when the user scrolls the panel

parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.commons.AccordionSection itself

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.commons.AccordionSection itself.

Event is fired when the user scrolls the panel

symbols.name: sap.ui.commons.Button
symbols.description: Enables users to trigger actions such as save or print. For the button UI, you can define some text or an icon, or both.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: Boolean property to enable the control (default is true). Buttons that are disabled have other colors than enabled ones, depending on custom settings.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Specifies the button height. If this property is set, the height which is specified by the underlying theme is not used any longer.

properties.name: helpId
properties.description: Unique identifier used for help service

properties.name: icon
properties.description: Icon to be displayed as graphical element within the button. This can be a URI to an image or an icon font URI.

properties.name: iconFirst
properties.description: If set to true (default), the display sequence is 1. icon 2. control text .

properties.name: iconHovered
properties.description: Icon to be displayed as graphical element within the button when it is hovered (only if also a base icon was specified). If not specified the base icon is used. If an icon font icon is used, this property is ignored.

properties.name: iconSelected
properties.description: Icon to be displayed as graphical element within the button when it is selected (only if also a base icon was specified). If not specified the base or hovered icon is used. If an icon font icon is used, this property is ignored.

properties.name: lite
properties.description: The button is rendered as lite button.

properties.name: style
properties.description: Style of the button. (e.g. emphasized)

properties.name: styled
properties.description: Indicates if the button is styled. If not it is rendered as native HTML-button. In this case a custom styling can be added usig addStyleClass.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Button text displayed at runtime.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Control width as common CSS-size (px or % as unit, for example)

associations.name: ariaDescribedBy
associations.description: Association to controls / ids which describe this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-describedby).

associations.name: ariaLabelledBy
associations.description: Association to controls / ids which label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

Sets a new value for property iconHovered.

Icon to be displayed as graphical element within the button when it is hovered (only if also a base icon was specified). If not specified the base icon is used. If an icon font icon is used, this property is ignored.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is empty string.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is empty string.

symbols.name: sap.ui.commons.Carousel
symbols.description: Carousel holds multiple controls and displays them vertically or horizontally next to each other. You can define how many content items should be displayed at once or let the Carousel determine that for you. Navigation is done through buttons or keys.

properties.description: Duration for animation when navigating through the contents of the Carousel

symbols.name: sap.ui.commons.CheckBox
symbols.description: Provides a box which can be flagged, the box has a label. A check box can either stand alone, or in a group with other check boxes. As an option, the boxes can initially be set to status 'Not Editable'.

properties.name: checked
properties.description: Contains the state of the control whether it is flagged with a check mark, or not

properties.name: editable
properties.description: Specifies whether the user shall be allowed to select the check box.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: Using this property, the control could be disabled, if required.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The 'name' property to be used in the HTML code, for example for HTML forms that send data to the server via submit.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Defines the text displayed next to the check box

properties.name: textDirection

symbols.name: sap.ui.commons.ComboBox
symbols.description: The control provides a field that allows end users to either enter some text, or to choose an entry out of a list of pre-defined items. The choosable items can be provided in the form of a complete ListBox, single ListItems.

properties.name: displaySecondaryValues
properties.description: Indicates whether the additionalText property that is available for sap.ui.core.ListItem shall be displayed in the list.

properties.name: maxPopupItems
properties.description: Defines the number of items that shall be displayed at once. If the overall number of items is higher than this setting, a scrollbar is provided.

properties.name: selectedItemId
properties.description:
Id of the selected item. If the value has no corresponding item, the selectedItemId is empty.

If the selectedItemId is set to a not existing item, it will not be changed.

properties.name: selectedKey
properties.description:
Key of the selected item.

If the value has no corresponding item the key is empty.

If duplicate keys exists the first item matching the key is used.

If the key is set to a not existing value it will not be changed.

aggregations.name: items
aggregations.description: ListItems (see sap.ui.core.ListBox) that shall be displayed in the list.

aggregations.name: myListBox
aggregations.description: The hidden ListBox which is only used when no shared ListBox is set via association listBox

associations.name: listBox
associations.description:
Using this method, you provide a ListBox control. This allows reuse of item lists in different controls. Either a control id can be used as new target, or a control instance.

Note: The ListBox must not be rendered somewhere in the UI. But if you want to bind the ListBox items to a model it must be in the control tree. So we suggest to add it as dependent somewhere (e.g. to the view or the first used ComboBox). If it is not set as child or dependant to an other control it will be automatically set as dependent to the first ComboBox where it is assigned.

symbols.name: sap.ui.commons.DatePicker
symbols.description: Allows end users to interact with dates. Entries can directly be written in, or selected from a calendar pad. Note: Dates can always be manually entered in the fix YYYYMMDD format, on top of the flexible "locale" format. If the value is provided via data binding, using a Date.type the formatter of the Date.type is used. Since version 1.22 the unified.Calendar is used inside the datePicker. So applications using the DatePicker should load the unified library. Otherwise it will be loaded the first time a DatePicker is opened.

properties.name: locale
properties.description: Defines the locale (language and country), e.g. "en-US", whose translations and Date formatters should be used to render the DatePicker.If the value property is bound to a model using a Date type the locale will be ignored, because the locale information of the model are used.

properties.name: yyyymmdd
properties.description: Defines the date as a "yyyymmdd" string, independent from the format used. The inherited textField "value" attribute uses the date format as configured via the locale. The date is interpreted as gregorian date

parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

Sets a new value for property yyyymmdd.

Defines the date as a "yyyymmdd" string, independent from the format used. The inherited textField "value" attribute uses the date format as configured via the locale. The date is interpreted as gregorian date

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

symbols.name: sap.ui.commons.Dialog
symbols.description: An interactive window appearing on request displaying information to the user. The API supports features such as popups with fixed sizes, popups with unlimited width, scrolling bars for large windows, and control nesting (for example, a drop-down list can be included in the window).

properties.name: accessibleRole
properties.description: The ARIA role for the control. E.g. for alert-style Dialogs this can be set to "AlertDialog".

properties.name: applyContentPadding
properties.description: Padding is theme-dependent. When set to "false", the content extends to the dialog borders.

properties.name: autoClose
properties.description:
If this property is set to true the Dialog will close if the Dialog loses its focus

Since: 1.10.

properties.name: contentBorderDesign
properties.description: Specifies the border design. Border design is theme dependent.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Outer height of dialog window. When not set and not constrained by one of the height parameters (minHeight/maxHeight), the window size is automatically adapted to the content.

properties.name: keepInWindow
properties.description:
Specifies whether Dialog movement should be restricted to the visible area of the window. This only affects drag&drop movements by the user. This doesn't affect modal dialogs -> modal dialogs always stay in the window.

Since: 1.9.0.

properties.name: maxHeight
properties.description: Maximum outer height of the dialog window. If set, neither the user nor some layout settings can make the window larger.

properties.name: maxWidth
properties.description: Maximum outer width of the dialog window. If set, neither the user nor some layout settings can make the window larger.

properties.name: minHeight
properties.description: Minimum outer height of the dialog window. When set, neither the user nor some layout settings can make the window smaller.

properties.name: minWidth
properties.description: Minimum outer width of the dialog window. When set, neither the user nor some layout settings can make the window smaller.

properties.name: modal
properties.description: Specifies whether the dialog should be modal, or not. In case of true the focus is kept inside the dialog.

properties.name: resizable
properties.description: Specifies whether the dialog window can be resized by the user. The dialog frame contains the visual symbol.

properties.name: scrollLeft
properties.description: Scroll position from left to right. "0" means leftmost position.

properties.name: scrollTop
properties.description: Scroll position from top to bottom. "0" means topmost position.

properties.name: showCloseButton
properties.description: Displays a close button in the title bar.

properties.name: title
properties.description: Dialog title displayed in the header.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Outer width of dialog window. When not set and not constrained by one of the width parameters (minWidth/maxWidth), the window size is automatically adapted to the content.

aggregations.name: buttons
aggregations.description: Aggregation of the buttons to display at the bottom of the dialog, for example OK and Cancel. Association defaultButton can be used for one of the defined buttons.

aggregations.name: content
aggregations.description:
Aggregation of the content of the dialog (one or more controls).

Warning: when content is added with width given as a percentage, the Dialog itself should have a width set.

associations.name: defaultButton
associations.description: Defines one of the buttons that have been provided via button aggregation to be the default button. This default button is initially selected, if no control is set via the initialFocus association explicitly. The default button is activated when Enter is pressed in the context of the dialog and when the currently selected element does not handle the Enter event itself.

associations.name: initialFocus
associations.description: Defines the control that shall get the focus when the dialog is opened.

methods.name: getEnabled

returnValue.description: indicates whether the dialog is currently enabled or not.

methods.description:
Determines whether the dialog is currently enabled or not.

Applications can't control the enabled state via a property. A dialog is implicitly enabled depending on its openState. Descendant controls that honor the enabled state of their ancestors will appear disabled after the dialog is closed.

experimental.text:
Whether a dialog is regarded as "enabled" during the state transitions (OPENING, CLOSING) is not fully decided. Currently, it is enabled during the OPENING phase and disabled during the CLOSING phase. The only potential change would be to treat the OPENING phase as disabled as well. Applications should be prepared to receive events from "enabled" controls after they called open() on the dialog until close() is called on it. If the mentioned potential change should happen, the dialog will become enabled only after the transition to OPEN. Events from "enabled" children then can still only arrive between open() and close(), so applications that obey the previous rule should continue to work. Only end users or code that explicitly triggers pseudo user events will notice a difference.
A second aspect that might change is the visual behavior of the content: during the CLOSING phase it 'looks' enabled but in fact it is already disabled. This avoids unnecessary redraws for content that becomes hidden soon. Should this show to be confusing for end users, it might be changed.

symbols.name: sap.ui.commons.DropdownBox
symbols.description: The control provides a field that allows end users to an entry out of a list of pre-defined items. The choosable items can be provided in the form of a complete ListBox, single ListItems.

properties.name: maxHistoryItems
properties.description:
Maximum number of history items in the list.

If 0 no history is displayed or stored. The history is locally stored on the client. Therefore do not activate this feature when this control handles confidential data.

Sets a new value for property maxHistoryItems.

Maximum number of history items in the list.

If 0 no history is displayed or stored. The history is locally stored on the client. Therefore do not activate this feature when this control handles confidential data.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is 0.

symbols.name: sap.ui.commons.form.SimpleForm
symbols.description: Use the SimpleForm to create a form based on title, label and fields that are stacked in the content aggregation. Add Title to start a new FormContainer(Group). Add Label to start a new row in the container. Add Input/Display controls as needed. Use LayoutData to influence the layout for special cases in the Input/Display controls.

properties.name: layout
properties.description:
The FormLayout that is used to render the SimpleForm.

We recommend using the GridLayout for rendering a SimpleForm in sap.ui.commons library, as responsive layouts are not designed for this library.

Note If possible, set the layout before adding content to prevent calculations for the default layout.

Note The ResponsiveLayout has been deprecated and must no longer be used.

Since: 1.14.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new form/SimpleForm.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

parameters.description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class

We recommend using the GridLayout for rendering a SimpleForm in sap.ui.commons library, as responsive layouts are not designed for this library.

Note If possible, set the layout before adding content to prevent calculations for the default layout.

Note The ResponsiveLayout has been deprecated and must no longer be used.

Default value is ResponsiveLayout.

methods.description:

The FormLayout that is used to render the SimpleForm.

We recommend using the GridLayout for rendering a SimpleForm in sap.ui.commons library, as responsive layouts are not designed for this library.

Note If possible, set the layout before adding content to prevent calculations for the default layout.

symbols.name: sap.ui.commons.HorizontalDividerHeight
symbols.description:
Enumeration of possible HorizontalDivider height settings.

This enum is part of the 'sap/ui/commons/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'HorizontalDividerHeight'.

properties.name: sap.ui.commons.HorizontalDividerHeight.Large
properties.description: Divider gets a large top and bottom margin.

properties.name: sap.ui.commons.HorizontalDividerHeight.Medium
properties.description: Divider gets a medium top and bottom margin.

properties.name: sap.ui.commons.HorizontalDividerHeight.Ruleheight
properties.description: Divider gets no top and bottom margin.

properties.name: sap.ui.commons.HorizontalDividerHeight.Small
properties.description: Divider gets a small top and bottom margin.

symbols.name: sap.ui.commons.Image
symbols.description: A wrapper around the IMG tag. The image can be loaded from a remote or local server. There are various size setting options available, and the images can be combined with actions.

properties.name: alt
properties.description: The alternative text that is displayed in case the Image is not available, or cannot be displayed. If the image is set to decorative this property is ignored.

properties.name: decorative
properties.description: A decorative image is included for design reasons. Accessibility tools will ignore decorative images. Note: If the Image has an image map (useMap is set), this property will be overridden (the image will not be rendered as decorative). A decorative image has no ALT attribute, so the Alt property is ignored if the image is decorative.

properties.name: height
properties.description: When the empty value is kept, the original size is not changed. It is also possible to make settings for width or height only, the overall size is maintained then, considering the aspect ratio.

properties.name: src
properties.description: Relative or absolute path to URL where the image file is stored.

properties.name: useMap
properties.description: The name of the image map that defines the clickable areas

properties.name: width
properties.description: When the empty value is kept, the original size is not changed. It is also possible to make settings for width or height only, the overall size is maintained then, considering the aspect ratio.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new Image.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

events.description: Event is fired when the user clicks on the control.

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.commons.Image itself

methods.description:
Attaches event handler fnFunction to the press event of this sap.ui.commons.Image.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.commons.Image itself.

Event is fired when the user clicks on the control.

symbols.name: sap.ui.commons.InPlaceEdit
symbols.description: The InPlaceEdit is a functionality to have text in display mode that can be changed in place.

properties.name: design
properties.description:
Defines the visual appearance of the control. Currently this is not supported for Labels.

Since: 1.9.0.

properties.name: undoEnabled
properties.description: If undo is enabled after changing the text an undo button appears.

properties.name: valueState
properties.description: Visualizes warnings or errors related to the InPlaceEdit. Possible values: Warning, Error, Success. If the content control has an own valueState property this will be used.

aggregations.name: content
aggregations.description: Content control of the InPlaceEdit. The following controls are allowed: TextField, ComboBox, DropdownBox and Link

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new InPlaceEdit.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

events.name: change

parameters.name: newValue
parameters.description: The new / changed value of the InPlaceEdit.

methods.name: getTooltip

returnValue.description: The tooltip for this Element.

methods.description:
Returns the tooltip for this InPlaceEdit if any or an undefined value. The tooltip can either be a simple string or a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase.

Callers that are only interested in tooltips of type string (e.g. to render them as a title attribute), should call the convenience method #getTooltip_AsString instead. If they want to get a tooltip text no matter where it comes from (be it a string tooltip or the text from a TooltipBase instance) then they could call #getTooltip_Text instead.

If a content control is assigned to the InPlaceEdit the tooltip of this control is used. A directly set tooltip to the InPlaceEdit is ignored in this case.

methods.name: getUndoEnabled

returnValue.description: Value of property undoEnabled

methods.description:
Gets current value of property undoEnabled.

If undo is enabled after changing the text an undo button appears.

Default value is true.

methods.description:
Gets current value of property valueState.

Visualizes warnings or errors related to the InPlaceEdit. Possible values: Warning, Error, Success. If the content control has an own valueState property this will be used.

Default value is None.

If a new tooltip is set, any previously set tooltip is deactivated.

If a content control is assigned to the InPlaceEdit the tooltip of this control is used. A directly set tooltip to the InPlaceEdit is ignored in this case.

symbols.name: sap.ui.commons.Label
symbols.description: The control is used for labeling other controls. The API provides formatting options, for example, for bold display or alignment. A label can have an icon.

properties.name: design
properties.description: Defines whether the labels are in bold format.

properties.name: icon
properties.description: Determines the icon to be displayed in the control. This can be a URI to an image or an icon font URI.

properties.name: required
properties.description:
Allows to enforce the required indicator even when the associated control doesn't have a getRequired method (a required property) or when the flag is not set. If the associated control has a required property, the values of both required flags are combined with the OR operator, so a Label can't override a required=true value.

Since: 1.11.0.

properties.name: requiredAtBegin
properties.description:
Determines whether the required indicator is at the beginning of the label (if set) or at the end (if not set).

Since: 1.14.0.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Determines the text to be displayed.

properties.name: textAlign
properties.description: Determines the alignment of the text. Available options are Begin, Center, End, Left, and Right.

properties.name: textDirection
properties.description: Determines the text direction - right-to-left (RTL) and left-to-right (LTR).

properties.name: width
properties.description: Determines the control width as common CSS-size (for example, px or % as unit).

properties.name: wrapping
properties.description: Specifies whether a line wrapping width shall be displayed when the text value is longer than the width is.

associations.name: labelFor
associations.description: Defines the association to the labeled control. By default, the label is set the for the attribute to the ID of the labeled control. This can be changed with the implementation of function getIdForLabel on the labelled control.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new Label.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

symbols.name: sap.ui.commons.layout.BorderLayout
symbols.description: Based upon the border layout as it comes with the Java standard. Using this layout, you are able to divide your available UI space into five areas whose sizes can be defined. These areas are: Top: Header; Bottom: Footer; Begin: Left/right-hand side panel; Center: Content area in the middle; End: Right/left-hand side panel.

symbols.description:
Horizontal alignment, e.g. of a layout cell's content within the cell's borders. Note that some values depend on the current locale's writing direction while others do not.

This enum is part of the 'sap/ui/commons/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'layout.HAlign'.

properties.description: Aligned towards the end of a line, in the current locale's writing direction.

symbols.name: sap.ui.commons.layout.MatrixLayout
symbols.description:
A matrix layout arranges controls in a grid structure, using rows which need not have the same number of cells.

It uses predefined cell classes that guarantee appropriate distances between cells in the grid. The cell's vGutter property lets you specify additional horizontal distances easily. You can set these additional distances (known as gutters) with or without separators. The distance for each cell is specified by assigning a specific enumeration value of the class LayoutCellSeparator of the matrix data object.

You should avoid nesting matrix layouts. You should only use a matrix layout if you need to align controls horizontally across rows.

properties.name: columns
properties.description: Number of columns. If not specified, the number of columns will be determined from the given cells.

properties.name: height
properties.description: CSS height of the matrix layout.

properties.name: layoutFixed
properties.description: Sets the table layout. If fixed the width parameter of a column has priority, if not the width of the content of the colums has priority. The default is "fixed". If the fixed layout is used an adequate width of the MatrixLayout should be provided. Otherwise the column width displayed could be different than the given ones because of browser dependend optimazations.

properties.name: width
properties.description: CSS width of the matrix layout. If the LayoutFixed = true an adequate width should be provided.

properties.name: widths
properties.description: Widths of the columns. Use an array to define the widths of the columns. If a column shall have an automatical sizing enter "auto" for this column width.

aggregations.name: rows
aggregations.description: The matrix layout's individual rows.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

Each argument must be either a matrix layout cell, which is added to the row "as is", or an arbitrary content control, which is wrapped with a new (default) matrix layout cell first and then added to the row.

parameters.description: New value for property layoutFixed

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property layoutFixed.

Sets the table layout. If fixed the width parameter of a column has priority, if not the width of the content of the colums has priority. The default is "fixed". If the fixed layout is used an adequate width of the MatrixLayout should be provided. Otherwise the column width displayed could be different than the given ones because of browser dependend optimazations.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is true.

properties.name: backgroundDesign
properties.description: Determines the matrix layout cell's background design.

properties.name: colSpan
properties.description: Determines how many columns of the underlying grid structure are occupied by this matrix layout cell.

properties.name: hAlign
properties.description: Determines the horizontal alignment of the matrix layout cell's content with the cell's borders.

properties.name: padding
properties.description: Determines the padding of the matrix layout cell's content within the cell's borders. The default value is appropriate for all cells in a form-like layout. Consider to remove the padding on the outer layout in case of nesting.

properties.name: rowSpan
properties.description: Determines how many rows of the underlying grid structure are occupied by this matrix layout cell. In case a row-height is used, all rows affected by the RowSpan must have the same unit.

properties.name: separation
properties.description: Determines how a matrix layout cell is separated from its predecessor, via a vertical gutter of variable width, with or without a vertical line.

properties.name: vAlign
properties.description: Determines the vertical alignment of the matrix layout cell's content with the cell's borders.

aggregations.name: content
aggregations.description:
The matrix layout cell's content (arbitrary controls).

If the matrix row has a defined height and the matrix has layoutFixed = true, the controls inside of a cell should all use the same unit for its height property.

parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new layout/MatrixLayoutCell.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

methods.name: addContent

parameters.description: The content to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

methods.description: Adds some content to the aggregation content.

methods.name: addStyleClass

parameters.name: sStyleClass
parameters.description: the CSS class name to be added

methods.description:
The string given as "sStyleClass" will be added to the "class" attribute of this element's root HTML element.

This method is intended to be used to mark controls as being of a special type for which special styling can be provided using CSS selectors that reference this style class name.

Example:
myButton.addStyleClass("myRedTextButton"); // add a CSS class to one button instance

...and in CSS:
.myRedTextButton {
color: red;
}

This will add the CSS class "myRedTextButton" to the Button HTML and the CSS code above will then make the text in this particular button red.

Only characters allowed inside HTML attributes are allowed. Quotes are not allowed and this method will ignore any strings containing quotes. Strings containing spaces are interpreted as ONE custom style class (even though CSS selectors interpret them as different classes) and can only removed later by calling removeStyleClass() with exactly the same (space-containing) string as parameter. Multiple calls with the same sStyleClass will have no different effect than calling once. If sStyleClass is null, the call is ignored.

Returns this to allow method chaining

symbols.name: sap.ui.commons.layout.Padding
symbols.description:
Padding, e.g. of a layout cell's content within the cell's borders. Note that all options except "None" include a padding of 2px at the top and bottom, and differ only in the presence of a 4px padding towards the beginning or end of a line, in the current locale's writing direction.

This enum is part of the 'sap/ui/commons/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'layout.Padding'.

properties.name: sap.ui.commons.layout.Padding.Begin
properties.description: Top and bottom padding of 2px. Padding of 4px towards the beginning of a line, in the current locale's writing direction, but none towards its end.

properties.name: sap.ui.commons.layout.Padding.Both
properties.description: Top and bottom padding of 2px. Padding of 4px towards both the beginning and end of a line.

properties.name: sap.ui.commons.layout.Padding.End
properties.description: Top and bottom padding of 2px. Padding of 4px towards the end of a line, in the current locale's writing direction, but none towards its beginning.

properties.name: sap.ui.commons.layout.Padding.Neither
properties.description: Top and bottom padding of 2px. No padding towards neither the beginning nor end of a line.

properties.name: sap.ui.commons.layout.Padding.None
properties.description: No padding at all.

symbols.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.38

symbols.name: sap.ui.commons.layout.Separation
symbols.description:
Separation, e.g. of a layout cell from its neighbor, via a vertical gutter of defined width, with or without a vertical line in its middle.

This enum is part of the 'sap/ui/commons/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'layout.Separation'.

properties.name: sap.ui.commons.layout.Separation.Large
properties.description: A large (63px) vertical gutter without a vertical line.

properties.name: sap.ui.commons.layout.Separation.LargeWithLine
properties.description: A large (63px) vertical gutter with a vertical line in its middle.

properties.name: sap.ui.commons.layout.Separation.Medium
properties.description: A medium (31px) vertical gutter without a vertical line.

properties.name: sap.ui.commons.layout.Separation.MediumWithLine
properties.description: A medium (31px) vertical gutter with a vertical line in its middle.

properties.name: sap.ui.commons.layout.Separation.None
properties.description: No gutter at all (0px), and without a vertical line, of course.

properties.name: sap.ui.commons.layout.Separation.Small
properties.description: A small (17px) vertical gutter without a vertical line.

properties.name: sap.ui.commons.layout.Separation.SmallWithLine
properties.description: A small (17px) vertical gutter with a vertical line in its middle.

symbols.name: sap.ui.commons.Link
symbols.description: Provides an absolute or relative reference to an internal or external URL. The classical target parameters are supported. Another usage scenario is triggering an action, for example to open a popup window. In both cases, the link is a hypertext link.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: Whether the link can be triggered by the user.

properties.name: helpId
properties.description: Unique identifier used for help service.

properties.name: href
properties.description: The link target URI. Supports standard hyperlink behavior. If an action should be triggered, this should not be set, but instead an event handler for the "press" event should be registered.

properties.name: target
properties.description: Options are _self, _top, _blank, _parent, _search. Alternatively, a frame name can be entered.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Link text to be displayed.

properties.name: width
properties.description:
Width of text link. When it is set (CSS-size such as % or px), this is the exact size. When left blank, the text defines the size.

Since: 1.8.0.

symbols.name: sap.ui.commons.ListBox
symbols.description: Provides a list of items from which users can choose an item. For the design of the list box, features such as defining the list box height, fixing the number of visible items, choosing one item to be the item that is marked by default when the list box is shown, or a scroll bar for large list boxes are available.

properties.name: allowMultiSelect
properties.description: Determines whether multiple selection is allowed.

properties.name: displayIcons
properties.description: Determines whether the icons of the list items shall also be displayed. Enabling icons requires some space to be reserved for them. Displaying icons can also influence the width and height of a single item, which affects the overall height of the ListBox when defined in number of items. Note that the number of icons that can be displayed in the ListBox depends on the size of the icons themselves and of the total ListBox height.

properties.name: displaySecondaryValues
properties.description: Determines whether the text values from the additionalText property (see sap.ui.core.ListItems) shall be displayed.

properties.name: editable
properties.description: Determines whether the ListBox is interactive or not. Can be used to disable interaction with mouse or keyboard.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: Determines whether the ListBox is enabled or not. Can be used to disable interaction with mouse or keyboard. Disabled controls have another color display depending on custom settings.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Control height as common CSS-size (px or % as unit, for example). The setting overrides any definitions made for the setVisibleItems() method.

properties.name: maxWidth
properties.description: Determines the maximum width of the ListBox. If not set, there is no maximum width.

properties.name: minWidth
properties.description: Determines the minimum width of the ListBox. If not set, there is no minimum width.

properties.name: scrollTop
properties.description: Scroll bar position from the top. Setting the scrollTop property and calling scrollToIndex are two operations influencing the same "physical" property, so the last call "wins".

properties.name: secondaryValueTextAlign
properties.description: Determines the text alignment in the secondary ListBox text column (if available).

properties.name: valueTextAlign
properties.description: Determines the text alignment in the primary ListBox column.

properties.name: visibleItems
properties.description: The ListBox height in number of items that are initially displayed without scrolling. This setting overwrites height settings in terms of CSS size that have been made. When the items have different heights, the height of the first item is used for all other item height calculations. Note that if there are one or more separators between the visible ListBox items, the displayed items might not relate 1:1 to the initially specified number of items. When the value is retrieved, it equals the previously set value if it was set; otherwise, it will be the number of items completely fitting into the ListBox without scrolling in the case the control was already rendered. Note that if the control was not rendered, the behavior will be undefined, it may return -1 or any other number.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Control width as common CSS-size (px or % as unit, for example).

aggregations.name: items
aggregations.description: Aggregation of items to be displayed. Must be either of type sap.ui.core.ListItem or sap.ui.core.SeparatorItem.

associations.name: ariaDescribedBy
associations.description: Association to controls / ids which describe this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-describedby).

associations.name: ariaLabelledBy
associations.description: Association to controls / ids which label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

parameters.description: The currently selected item of the ListBox. In the case of multiple selection, this is exactly one of the selected items - the one whose selection has triggered the selection change.

parameters.description: Array containing the indices which are selected.

returnValue.description: this to allow method chaining.

parameters.name: iIndex
parameters.description: The index to which the ListBox should scroll.

parameters.name: bLazy
parameters.description: If set to true, the ListBox only scrolls if the item is not completely visible, and it scrolls for exactly the space to make it fully visible. If set to false, the item is scrolled to the top position (if possible).

methods.description: If the ListBox has a scroll bar because the number of items is larger than the number of visible items, this method scrolls to the item with the given index. If there are enough items, this item will then appear at the topmost visible position in the ListBox. If bLazy is true, it only scrolls as far as required to make the item visible. Setting the scrollTop property and calling scrollToIndex are two operations influencing the same "physical" property, so the last call "wins".

parameters.name: bDisplayIcons
parameters.description: New value for property displayIcons

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property displayIcons.

Determines whether the icons of the list items shall also be displayed. Enabling icons requires some space to be reserved for them. Displaying icons can also influence the width and height of a single item, which affects the overall height of the ListBox when defined in number of items. Note that the number of icons that can be displayed in the ListBox depends on the size of the icons themselves and of the total ListBox height.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is false.

The previous selection is replaced in any case.

symbols.name: sap.ui.commons.Menu
symbols.description: A menu is an interactive element which provides a choice of different actions to the user. These actions (items) can also be organized in submenus. Like other dialog-like controls, the menu is not rendered within the control hierarchy. Instead it can be opened at a specified position via a function call.

parameters.description: Id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

Constructor for a new Menu control.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

This class does not have its own settings, but all settings applicable to the base type sap.ui.unified.Menu can be used.

symbols.name: sap.ui.commons.MenuBar
symbols.description: Represents a user interface area which is the entry point for menus with their menu items. MenuBar is useful for applications which shall offer a set of actions that shall be provided in a structured way. The MenuBar contains the menu titles from where users navigate to the single items. The control supports for example long menu item texts, automated scrolling for menu items when the browser space is not large enough to display all items, defining images for single or all items in a menu, automated layouting of items with or w/o image, and active/non-active items.

symbols.description: Special menu item which contains a label and a text field. This menu item is e.g. helpful for filter implementations. The aggregation submenu (inherited from parent class) is not supported for this type of menu item.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: Id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new MenuTextFieldItem element.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

This class does not have its own settings, but all settings applicable to the base type sap.ui.unified.MenuTextFieldItem can be used.

methods.description:
Registers a callback function to be invoked if long text Details are to be made available.

This callback function will be supplied the corresponding Message "id", and should return the (simple) HTML string to be displayed within the Message Details Dialog.

E.g.: myMessage.bindDetails(getDetails); function getDetails(sId) {... return htmlString;}

properties.description: Type: sap.ui.core.Popup.Dock SnapPoint of MessageBar over anchorId. Note: Use "begin" or "end" for RTL support. Note: "center" is not indicated, as positioning is only set once, either via the css "left" or the "right" attribute. Therefore a MessageBar will only be extended in one direction, as Messages come in.

properties.description: Maximum number of simultaneous messages being toasted in a row. Value '0' means this dynamic part is switched off.

symbols.name: sap.ui.commons.MessageBox
symbols.description:
Provides methods to create standard alerts, confirmation dialogs, or arbitrary message boxes.

As MessageBox is a static class, a jQuery.sap.require("sap.ui.commons.MessageBox"); statement must be explicitly executed before the class can be used. Example: 

  jQuery.sap.require("sap.ui.commons.MessageBox");
  sap.ui.commons.MessageBox.show(
      "This message should appear in the message box.",
      sap.ui.commons.MessageBox.Icon.INFORMATION,
      "My message box title",
      [sap.ui.commons.MessageBox.Action.YES, sap.ui.commons.MessageBox.Action.NO],
      function() { / * do something * / }
  );

methods.name: sap.ui.commons.MessageBox.alert

parameters.name: vMessage
parameters.description: Message to be displayed in the alert box

parameters.name: fnCallback
parameters.description: callback function to be called when the user closed the dialog

parameters.name: sTitle
parameters.description: Title to be displayed in the alert box

parameters.name: sDialogId
parameters.description: ID to be used for the alert box. Intended for test scenarios, not recommended for productive apps

methods.description:
Displays an alert box with the given message and an OK button (no icons). If a callback is given, it is called after the alert box has been closed by the user via the OK button or via the Close icon. The callback is called with the following signature:

  function ()

The alert box opened by this method is modal and it is processed asynchronously. Applications have to use the fnCallback to continue work after the user closed the alert box.

methods.name: sap.ui.commons.MessageBox.confirm

parameters.name: vMessage
parameters.description: Message to display

parameters.name: fnCallback
parameters.description: Callback to be called

parameters.name: sTitle
parameters.description: Title to display

parameters.name: sDialogId
parameters.description: ID to be used for the confirmation dialog. Intended for test scenarios, not recommended for productive apps

methods.description:
Displays a confirmation dialog box with the given message, a question icon, an OK button, and a Cancel button. If a callback is given, it is called after the alert box has been closed by the user via one of the buttons or via the close icon. The callback is called with the following signature

  function(bConfirmed)

where bConfirmed is set to true when the user has activated the OK button.

The confirmation dialog box opened by this method is modal and it is processed asynchronously. Applications have to use the fnCallback to continue work after the user closed the alert box.

methods.name: sap.ui.commons.MessageBox.show

parameters.name: vMessage
parameters.description: The message to be displayed.

parameters.name: oIcon
parameters.description: The icon to be displayed.

parameters.name: sTitle
parameters.description: The title of the message box.

parameters.name: vActions
parameters.description: Either a single action, or an array of actions. If no action(s) are given, the single action MessageBox.Action.OK is taken as a default for the parameter.

parameters.name: fnCallback
parameters.description: Function to be called when the user has pressed a button or has closed the message box.

parameters.name: oDefaultAction
parameters.description: Must be one of the actions provided in vActions.

parameters.name: sDialogId
parameters.description: ID to be used for the dialog. Intended for test scenarios, not recommended for productive apps

methods.description:
Creates and displays a simple message box with the given text and buttons, and optionally other parts. After the user has selected a button or closed the message box using the close icon, the callback function is invoked when given.

The only mandatory parameter is vMessage. Either a string with the corresponding text or even a layout control could be provided.

The created dialog box is executed asynchronously. When it has been created and registered for rendering, this function returns without waiting for a user reaction.

When applications have to react on the users choice, they have to provide a callback function and postpone any reaction on the user choice until that callback is triggered.

The signature of the callback is

function (oAction);

where oAction is the button that the user has pressed. When the user has pressed the close button, a MessageBox.Action.Close is returned.
methods.code: sap.ui.commons.MessageBox.show(vMessage, oIcon?, sTitle?, vActions?, fnCallback?, oDefaultAction?, sDialogId?) : void

symbols.name: sap.ui.commons.MessageBox.Action
symbols.description:
Enumeration of supported actions in a MessageBox.

Each action is represented as a button in the message box. The values of this enumeration are used for both, specifying the set of allowed actions as well as reporting back the user choice.

This enum is part of the 'sap/ui/commons/MessageBox' module export and must be accessed by the property 'Action'.

properties.name: sap.ui.commons.MessageBox.Action.ABORT
properties.description: Adds an "Abort" button to the message box.

properties.name: sap.ui.commons.MessageBox.Action.CANCEL
properties.description: Adds a "Cancel" button to the message box.

properties.name: sap.ui.commons.MessageBox.Action.CLOSE
properties.description: Adds a "Close" button to the message box.

properties.name: sap.ui.commons.MessageBox.Action.IGNORE
properties.description: Adds an "Ignore" button to the message box.

properties.name: sap.ui.commons.MessageBox.Action.NO
properties.description: Adds a "No" button to the message box.

properties.name: sap.ui.commons.MessageBox.Action.OK
properties.description: Adds an "Ok" button to the message box.

properties.name: sap.ui.commons.MessageBox.Action.RETRY
properties.description: Adds a "Retry" button to the message box.

properties.name: sap.ui.commons.MessageBox.Action.YES
properties.description: Adds a "Yes" button to the message box.

parameters.description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.commons.MessageToast itself

methods.description:
Attaches event handler fnFunction to the next event of this sap.ui.commons.MessageToast.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.commons.MessageToast itself.

Fired once the toast() method is over, so that the MessageBar can "toast" another message if needed.

symbols.name: sap.ui.commons.Paginator
symbols.description: Provides navigation between pages within a list of numbered pages.

properties.name: currentPage
properties.description: Represents the current page (first page has index 1, not 0, to match the visual number)

properties.name: numberOfPages
properties.description: Represents the overall number of pages that are embedded into the parent control

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new Paginator.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

events.name: page

parameters.name: srcPage
parameters.description: The page which is the current one before the page event is fired (and another page is displayed)

parameters.name: targetPage
parameters.description:
The page that shall be displayed next after the page event is fired.

The page number is 1-based: the first page has index 1, not 0, to match the number visible in the UI.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Provides the values 'First', 'Last', 'Next', 'Previous', 'Goto'. The event parameter informs the application how the user navigated to the new page: Whether the 'Next' button was used, or another button, or whether the page was directly selected

events.description: Event is fired when the user navigates to another page by selecting it directly, or by jumping forward/backward.

methods.name: attachPage

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.commons.Paginator itself

methods.description:
Attaches event handler fnFunction to the page event of this sap.ui.commons.Paginator.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.commons.Paginator itself.

Event is fired when the user navigates to another page by selecting it directly, or by jumping forward/backward.

methods.name: detachPage

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called, when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

methods.description:
Detaches event handler fnFunction from the page event of this sap.ui.commons.Paginator.

The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

symbols.name: sap.ui.commons.Panel
symbols.description: Represents a container with scroll functionality, that can be used for text and controls. The Panel does not layout the embedded controls.

properties.name: applyContentPadding
properties.description: Determines whether the Panel will have padding. Padding is theme-dependent.

properties.name: areaDesign
properties.description: Determines the background color. Note that color settings are theme-dependent.

properties.name: borderDesign
properties.description: Determines if the Panel can have a box as border. Note that displaying borders is theme-dependent.

properties.name: collapsed
properties.description: Determines whether the Panel will be initially collapsed. When it is initially collapsed, the contents are not rendered. A collapsed Panel consumes less space than an expanded one.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: Represents the state of the of the Panel (enabled or disabled)

properties.name: height
properties.description: Determines the height of the Panel in CSS size. Per default, the height for the Panel is automatically adjusted to the content. Dimension allows to explicitly specify the height.

properties.name: scrollLeft
properties.description: Determines the scroll position from left to right. Value "0" means leftmost position.

properties.name: scrollTop
properties.description: Determines the scroll position from top to bottom. Value "0" means topmost position.

properties.name: showCollapseIcon
properties.description: Determines whether the Panel will have an icon for collapsing/expanding, or not.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Specifies the text that is rendered in the Panel header. Can be used to create a simple titles that do not require an icon in the header.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Determines the width of the Panel in CSS size.

aggregations.name: buttons
aggregations.description: The buttons that shall be displayed in the Panel header

aggregations.name: content
aggregations.description: Aggregates the controls that are contained in the Panel. It is recommended to use a layout control as single direct child. When the Panel dimensions are set, the child control may have width and height of 100%. When the dimensions are not set, the child defines the size of the Panel.

aggregations.name: title
aggregations.description: Aggregates the title element of the Panel. For text titles only, you alternatively could use setText() which also creates a title in the background.

symbols.name: sap.ui.commons.ProgressIndicator
symbols.description: Shows the progress of a process in a graphical way. The indicator can be displayed with or without numerical values. The filling can be displayed in color only, or additionally with the percentage rate. The indicator status can be interactive.

properties.name: barColor
properties.description: Determines the color of the bar which visualizes the progress. Possible values defined in the sap.ui.core.BarColor enumeration are the following: CRITICAL (yellow), NEGATIVE (red), POSITIVE (green), NEUTRAL (blue) (default value).

properties.name: displayValue
properties.description: Determines the text value that will be displayed in the bar.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: Determines whether the control is enabled or not. Disabled controls have different colors, and can not be focused.

properties.name: percentValue
properties.description: Determines the numerical value for the displayed length of the progress bar.

properties.name: showValue
properties.description: Determines whether the percent value shall be rendered inside the bar.

properties.name: width

symbols.name: sap.ui.commons.RadioButton
symbols.description:
RadioButton is a control similar to CheckBox, but it allows the user to choose only one of the predefined set of options.

Usually, RadioButton is used in a group with other RadioButtons (with the groupName property or by using sap.ui.commons.RadioButtonGroup), thus providing a limited choice for the user. An event is triggered when the user makes a change of the selection.

properties.name: editable
properties.description: Specifies whether the user can select the RadioButton.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: Displays the disabled controls in another color, depending on the customer settings.

properties.name: groupName
properties.description: Defines the name of the RadioButtonGroup, in which the current RadioButton belongs to. You can define a new name for the group. If no new name is specified, the default is sapUiRbDefaultGroup. By default, when one of the RadioButtons in a group is selected, all others are unselected.

properties.name: key
properties.description: Can be used for subsequent actions.

properties.name: selected
properties.description: Specifies the select state of the RadioButton.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Defines the text displayed next to the RadioButton.

properties.name: textDirection
properties.description: Defines the text direction - options are left-to-right (LTR) and right-to-left (RTL). Alternatively, the control can inherit the text direction from its parent container.

properties.name: valueState
properties.description: Enumeration sap.ui.core.ValueState provides state values Error, Success, Warning and None.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Determines the control width. By default, it depends on the text length. Alternatively, CSS sizes in % or px can be set.
